Protocol.name: Demolink
Protocol.comment:
This is an demonstration protocol definition. This file demonstrates most things that the ProtoGen application can do regarding automatic protocol packing/upacking code generation.
ProtoGen can handle bitfields, enumerations, arrays, and can efficiently encode data for little or big endian architectures.

Include.name: indices.h
Include.comment: indices.h is included to for array length enumerations

Value.name: KEEPALIVE
Value.comment: Zero length packet used to refresh communications timeouts.

Value.name: CONSTANT
Value.comment: This packet just tests constant values

Packet.name: KeepAlive
Packet.comment: Send this packet to inform the receiver that the communications link is still active.

Data.name: api
Data.comment: the API of the sending side

Data.name: version
Data.comment: the version of the sending side

Structure.name: GPS
Structure.comment: Information from a GPS including the position, velocity, and quality data. This is a generic GPS description that should suffice for most GPS devices

Structure.name: PositionLLA
Structure.comment: Position in latitude, longitude, and altitude with respect to the WGS-84 ellipsoid

Data.name: latitude
Data.comment: The latitude of the position in radians, positive North

Data.name: longitude
Data.comment: The longitude of the position in radians, positive East

Data.name: altitude
Data.comment: The altitude above the WGS-84 ellipsoid of the position in meters

Data.name: north
Data.comment: velocity in the North direction

Data.name: east
Data.comment: velocity in the East direction

Data.name: down
Data.comment: velocity in the Down direction

Data.name: ITOW
Data.comment: GPS time of week in milliseconds

Data.name: Week
Data.comment: GPS week number

Data.name: PDOP
Data.comment: Position dilution of precision

Data.name: numSvInfo
Data.comment: The number of space vehicles for which there is data in this structure

Data.name: PRN
Data.comment: Satellite psuedo-random-number identifier

Data.name: elevation
Data.comment: elevation angle of the satellite in radians

Data.name: azimuth
Data.comment: azimuth angle of the satellite in radians

Data.name: L1CNo
Data.comment: Carrier to noise ratio in dB-Hz for the L1 frequency

Data.name: L2CNo
Data.comment: Carrier to noise ratio in dB-Hz for the L2 frequency

Data.name: visible
Data.comment: Set if the satellite should be visible

Data.name: tracked
Data.comment: Set if the satellite is tracked

Data.name: healthy
Data.comment: Set if the satellite is reporting itself as health

Data.name: used
Data.comment: Set if the satellite is used in the current PVT solution

Packet.name: EngineCommand
Packet.comment: Engine command packet. Send this packet to change the engines operating point. The command can be either a throttle or an RPM. The interpretation of the command is a function of the engine operating mode, see the EngineSettings packet.

Data.name: command
Data.comment: The engine command, which is a throttle or an RPM depending on the engine control mode

Packet.name: EngineSettings
Packet.comment: Change the engine control settings, including the operating mode and feedback gains. Engine settings are stored non-volatilely each time this packet is received. Send this packet with zero length to request the current engine settings.

Enum.name: engineModes
Enum.comment: Modes of operation for the engine

Value.name: openLoop
Value.comment: Engine control using direct throttle command with no feedback

Value.name: throttleToRPM
Value.comment: Throttle command is mapped to an RPM command

Value.name: directRPM
Value.comment: RPM is commanded directly by the user

Data.name: mode
Data.comment: Engine control mode of operation

Data.name: gain
Data.comment: proportional, integral, derivative gains from RPM error to throttle

Data.name: maxRPM
Data.comment: maximum RPM that can be commanded

Packet.name: ThrottleSettings
Packet.comment: Change the throttle control settings. The engine control laws output a throttle command signal from 0 to 1. The data in this packet are used to determine what pulse width to send to the servo for that throttle. The throttle to pulse width mapping can be a straight line, or a linearly interpolated table with up to 10 points.

Data.name: numCurvePoints
Data.comment: Number of points in the throttle curve

Data.name: enableCurve
Data.comment: Set to enable the throttle curve

Data.name: throttle
Data.comment: Throttle for this curve point, from 0.0 to 1.0

Data.name: PWM
Data.comment: PWM in microseconds for this curve point

Data.name: lowPWM
Data.comment: PWM in microseconds for 0% throttle

Data.name: highPWM
Data.comment: PWM in microseconds for 100% throttle

Data.name: year
Data.comment: year of the date

Data.name: month
Data.comment: month of the year, from 1 to 12

Data.name: day
Data.comment: day of the month, from 1 to 31

Structure.name: Board
Structure.comment: Manufacturing and calibration details about the board hardware

Data.name: manufactureDate
Data.comment: The date this board was manufactured

Data.name: calibratedDate
Data.comment: The date this board was calibrated and tested

Data.name: serialNumber
Data.comment: serial number of the board

Data.name: assemblyNumber
Data.comment: serial number of the assembly

Data.name: isCalibrated
Data.comment: set if the board has been calibrated

Packet.name: Version
Packet.comment: Version information for the software and hardware. Send this packet with zero lengtht to request the version information.

Data.name: board
Data.comment: details about this boards provenance

Data.name: major
Data.comment: major version of the software

Data.name: minor
Data.comment: minor version of the software

Data.name: sub
Data.comment: sub version of the software

Data.name: patch
Data.comment: patch version of the software

Data.name: date
Data.comment: the release date of the software

Data.name: description
Data.comment: description of the software version

Packet.name: Telemetry
Packet.comment: GPS and other position telemetry. This packet is transmitted spontaneously 4 times a second.

Enum.name: insMode_t
Enum.comment: Enumeration for the inertial navigation operational mode

Data.comment: Reserve 8 bytes of space for future expansion
Reserve an array for future expansion

Data.name: magIncluded

Data.name: laserIncluded
Data.comment: set if laser range finder data are included in this packet

Data.name: airDataIncluded
Data.comment: set if air data are included in this packet
Bits reserved for future use

Data.name: insMode

Data.name: numGPSs

Data.name: gpsData
Data.comment: Information from all possible GPS systems

Data.name: ECEF
Data.comment: Position in Earth-centered, Earth-fixed meters; not part of the packet

Data.name: numControls
Data.comment: number of control signals

Data.name: controls
Data.comment: control signals in radians or -1.0 to 1.0 for dimensionless controls

Data.name: numFueltanks
Data.comment: number of fuel tanks intalled

Data.name: fuel

Data.name: dynamicP

Data.name: staticP
Data.comment: Static pressure in Pascals

Data.name: OAT
Data.comment: Outside air temperature in Kelvin

Data.name: mag
Data.comment: magnetic field in nanoTesla in body X, Y, Z

Data.name: compassHeading
Data.comment: True heading computed by magnetic field in radians

Data.name: laserAGL
Data.comment: Altitude above ground in meters as measured by the laser altimeter

Packet.name: Constant

Data.constant: To be or not to be

Data.name: cos45
Data.comment: directly encoding floating point constant

Data.name: sin45
Data.comment: scaling a floating point constant

Data.name: constant3
Data.comment: encoding an integer constant

Data.name: token
Data.comment: A value that the user provides
